title: General
stimulusHtml:
15 points

1 point is earned for: every correctly translated segment. Student must correctly translate all words in a given segment to receive credit for that segment.

1. rex: king, ruler, sovereign, prince, chief(tan), lord, commander

Aeneas: Aeneas

2. erat: was

nobis: to/for us; of us (i.e., “the king of us was Aeneas”)

(Segments 1 and 2 can be translated idiomatically: “we had a king,” “our king was Aeneas”)

3. quo: than whom/which

4. alter: other, another person, anyone else, a second, (with nec) no one (else) [must be nominative]

nec . . . nec: neither . . . nor; (with alter) no one (else)/not anyone (else) . . . nor/and not

fuit: was, has been

5. iustior: more just, righteous, fair, equitable, justified, proper, correct [must be nominative and comparative]

pietate: in/with/by/at/from/because of piety, dutifulness, sense of duty, respect (for duties, etc.), loyalty, devotion

6. maior: greater, bigger, larger, more impressive, more powerful, better [must be nominative AND comparative]

7. bello: in/with/by/at/from/because of war, warfare, fighting, battle, military service/exploits (etc.)

et: and

armis: in/with/by/at/from/because of arms, weapons, armor, military implements (etc.), military service/exploits (etc.)

8. si: if

fata: (the) fate(s), decrees (of the gods, fate, etc.), destiny, lot(s), doom [must be nominative]

si: if

9. servant: watch over, guard, protect, mind, look after, look out for, keep (safe, etc.), save, conserve, preserve, maintain, retain, reserve (also acceptable: are watching over, etc.; do watch over, etc.)

10. quem: who, whom, which, this, that

virum: man, male (person) [must be accusative]

11. vescitur: he (Aeneas) feeds upon, devours, consumes, eats; make uses of, uses (also acceptable: he is feeding upon, etc.; he does feed upon, etc.)

aura: breeze, air, puff (of wind, air, etc.), wind, breath

aetheria: of the (upper) air/sky/heavens, heavenly, etherial, heaven-sent, divine; of the world of the living, of day (aura aetheria may be translated as “the air above” or “the upper air”)

12. neque: and not, nor

adhuc: yet, already, at present (time), at this time, so far, by now, still, to this point [must be

temporal]

13. occubat: he (Aeneas) lies (dead) (also acceptable: he is lying dead, etc.; he does lie dead, etc.)

14. crudelibus: cruel, fierce, ruthless, merciless, relentless, savage, inhuman(e), painful, grievous, grim, vehement

umbris: in/with/among shadow(s), shade(s), darkness, ghosts, the Underworld, the world of the dead, phantoms

15. non: not

metus: fear, alarm, apprehension, anxiety, dread

(Segment 15 can be translated idiomatically: “we have no fear,” “[there is] no fear [for us]”)

Student response earns none of the available points.

et: and

fata: (the) fate(s), decrees (of the gods, fate, etc.), destiny, lot(s), doom [must be nominative]

9. servant: watch over, guard, protect, mind, look after, look out for, keep (safe, etc.), save, conserve, preserve, maintain, retain, reserve (also acceptable: are watching over, etc.; do watch over, etc.)

virum: man, male (person) [must be accusative]

11. vescitur: he (Aeneas) feeds upon, devours, consumes, eats; make uses of, uses (also acceptable: he is feeding upon, etc.; he does feed upon, etc.)

aura: breeze, air, puff (of wind, air, etc.), wind, breath

aetheria: of the (upper) air/sky/heavens, heavenly, etherial, heaven-sent, divine; of the world of the living, of day (aura aetheria may be translated as “the air above” or “the upper air”)

temporal]

14. crudelibus: cruel, fierce, ruthless, merciless, relentless, savage, inhuman(e), painful, grievous, grim, vehement

umbris: in/with/among shadow(s), shade(s), darkness, ghosts, the Underworld, the world of the dead, phantoms

15. non: not

metus: fear, alarm, apprehension, anxiety, dread

(Segment 15 can be translated idiomatically: “we have no fear,” “[there is] no fear [for us]”)

Student response earns one of the available points.

7. bello: in/with/by/at/from/because of war, warfare, fighting, battle, military service/exploits (etc.)

et: and

armis: in/with/by/at/from/because of arms, weapons, armor, military implements (etc.), military service/exploits (etc.)

8. si: if

fata: (the) fate(s), decrees (of the gods, fate, etc.), destiny, lot(s), doom [must be nominative]

si: if

9. servant: watch over, guard, protect, mind, look after, look out for, keep (safe, etc.), save, conserve, preserve, maintain, retain, reserve (also acceptable: are watching over, etc.; do watch over, etc.)

10. quem: who, whom, which, this, that

virum: man, male (person) [must be accusative]

11. vescitur: he (Aeneas) feeds upon, devours, consumes, eats; make uses of, uses (also acceptable: he is feeding upon, etc.; he does feed upon, etc.)

aura: breeze, air, puff (of wind, air, etc.), wind, breath

aetheria: of the (upper) air/sky/heavens, heavenly, etherial, heaven-sent, divine; of the world of the living, of day (aura aetheria may be translated as “the air above” or “the upper air”)

12. neque: and not, nor

adhuc: yet, already, at present (time), at this time, so far, by now, still, to this point [must be

temporal]

13. occubat: he (Aeneas) lies (dead) (also acceptable: he is lying dead, etc.; he does lie dead, etc.)

14. crudelibus: cruel, fierce, ruthless, merciless, relentless, savage, inhuman(e), painful, grievous, grim, vehement

umbris: in/with/among shadow(s), shade(s), darkness, ghosts, the Underworld, the world of the dead, phantoms

15. non: not

metus: fear, alarm, apprehension, anxiety, dread

(Segment 15 can be translated idiomatically: “we have no fear,” “[there is] no fear [for us]”)
